title: Report a company car to HMRC

details.description: You need to tell HMRC about employees' company cars, vans or other vehicles by filling in form P46 (Car)
details.alternative_title: Tell HMRC about an employee’s company car
details.more_information:
To send form P46 (Car), you can:

* use HMRC's [PAYE Online](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/paye/file-or-pay/fileonline/intro.htm "PAYE Online"){:rel="external"} service for employers
* use [commercial payroll software](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/efiling/paye/paye_software_forms.htm "Commercial software options"){:rel="external"}
* use HMRC's [Basic PAYE Tools](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/paye/tools/basic-paye-tools.htm "Using HMRC's Basic PAYE Tools"){:rel="external"}
* [download and fill in a paper version](http://search2.hmrc.gov.uk/kb5/hmrc/forms/view.page?record=_J73DzVGt4o&formid=763 "download and fill in a paper version"){:rel="external"} (you can't use this to tell HMRC about replacement cars)

If you provide any cars for private use by company directors or employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-expenses-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more including expenses and benefits, you need to tell HMRC.

^‘Private use’ includes employees’ journeys between home and work, unless they’re travelling to a temporary place of work.^

You'll also need to [report on your end-of-year forms and pay](/expenses-and-benefits-company-cars "Expenses and benefits - company cars") Class 1A National Insurance on the value of the car benefit.

##Other reporting requirements

You also need to tell HMRC if:

* you stop providing a company car
* you provide someone with an additional car, available for private use
* someone you provide a car to becomes a director
* someone you provide a car starts earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-expenses-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more

##Exceptions

You don’t need to tell HMRC if you provide:

* 'pool' cars, which are used by more than one employee for business purposes, and normally kept on your premises
* cars adapted for use by employees with a disability, if the only private use is for journeys between home and work
* emergency vehicles used only by on-call employees of the police, fire and rescue, ambulance or paramedic services 

##When you need to tell HMRC

There are 4 deadlines for sending in form P46 (Car), depending on when the change to company cars you provide happens.

When the change takes place  | When you need to tell HMRC by
- | -
6 January to 5 April | 3 May
6 April to 5 July | 2 August
6 July to 5 October | 2 November
6 October to 5 January |  2 February


*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs
*[PAYE]: Pay As You Earn
